I would want to congratulate Bio and Credit Bank for beginning the journey to list at the Nairobi Securities Exchange
The growth of the capital markets needs to be a shared agenda for my government and private sector in good faith for our sucess
We must work deliberately to equalize and democratize opportunities for wealth acquisition for all Kenyans

I have instructed the relevant parties to commence the review of the Privatization Act with a view to repealing it and replacing it with a more facilitate framework that will accelerate privatizations
The government is embarking on reviewing the Privatisation Act to create a legal framework that will ease the structure of listing for companies
We will embark on privatisation of public corporations a way to generate wealth We intend to get between 5 10 mature public sectors companies listing at NSE in 12 months
We are under instructions to do a way with bureaucracy and red tape to accelerate the growth of the capital markets and we will work together with all industry players to achieve this goal
The capital markets industry is our very serious partner in driving the economic transformation of Kenya

I am reliably informed that investment is a function of savings Without a savings culture we cannot participate meaningfully in investment I am working with existing entities like NSSF to promote a savings culture
Follow the proceedings live
We are ready to forgive some sins in the best interests of moving forward together

I encourage the private sector companies to work together with and the NSE to list For those that are reluctant to list because of issues around tax we will work together with them to deal with any impediments

I m committed to operationalize the National Investment Council We ve it in our manifesto to explore alternative sources of money for development amp have listed the sale of profitable government agencies to Kenyans and we shall deliver on that
His Excellency has today committed that the Government will support the privatization of six to ten State Owned Enterprises within the next twelve months
Public sector and state owned listings have driven up other markets and we hope that we can realize the same here at NSE Board Chair Mr Kiprono Kittony
2 2 I look forward to having as many Kenyans trading on the NSE and being able to generate wealth for themselves courtesy of the stock exchange

1 2 I believe and there is demonstrated evidence that the stock market under the NSE has significant potential to grow this economy through providing development capital through among other things listing of public companies
LAUNCH OF THE NSE MARKET PLACE
The list of listed firms can be found on our website

Additionally the NSE Market Place will provide an accelerated listing route for leading companies through offering client focused advisory and guidance to potential issuers significantly reducing the time to market

Equally working closely with local and international media the NSE Market Place will open the trading floor for access to all media houses to communicate investment and economic related information from the NSE increasing awareness of opportunities in Kenya

Similarly the NSE Market place will help highlight opportunities for global companies looking to for international expansion specifically in Africa to consider listing on the Kenyan market and commencing operations

The NSE Market Place will provide a platform for Kenya to communicate investment opportunities to the world positioning the country as a hub for trade enabling Kenya attract fresh foreign direct investments across various leading and emerging sectors in Kenya

Welcome to the NSE Market Place The Market Place is an initiative that seeks to revive market activity and boost growth in our domestic capital market through addressing both supply and demand side of the market to accelerate growth

With representation from the Government KENYA and KE the PLC joined in for the 6th year in its concerted effort for gender equality

“In spite of the visible challenges at home and plausible ceilings at work the government seeks to create opportunities for both women and men to develop to their full potential ” CS Public Service and Gender Affairs

“I want to thank H E Uhuru Kenyatta for championing women more so with the Government response to COVID 19’s effect on them The Government is driven by the aim to have a more equal environment by 2030 ” CS Public Service and Gender Affairs

This morning we were delighted to witness KE become the first in their 20 country presence sign on the Women Empowerment Principles These 7 Economic principles that have been developed to better aid women achieve gender equality
“On our part I’m pleased to state that at KE 50 of management are women with 33 represented on the Board ” Mary Mulili Executive Director KE
“@UBA KE celebrates this year’s IWD theme which is aligned and entrenched in our commitment to women development inclusion and progression ” Mary Mulili Executive Director KE
“@unwomenkenya have launched the Unstereotype alliance to help media analyze stereotypes and how that affects economic empowerment of women ” Elizabeth Obando Team Lead Women Economic Empowerment
“Gender equality is about providing equal opportunities for all With private sector provided the highest opportunity for economic development ” Elizabeth Obando Team Lead Women Economic Empowerment
“Kenya is the first to roll out this 10 month program with 14 companies taking part The aim is to help companies close the gender gap within the next 10 years ” njino Executive Director

“@GlobalcompactKE initiated a program called Target Equality in 2020 This was from the knowledge that many companies had the goodwill to ensure Gender Equality however had not actioned it ” njino Executive Director
“We know for certain that Investors not only look at company financials they also look at governance in regards to inclusion more so for women ” CEO PLC
Ladies have incredible self initiative and drive and this must be matched by companies being deliberate towards balancing their boards
“I’m happy to report that as of 2020 over 500 000 investors in the PLC are women with share value of KES 2 4 Billion ” CEO PLC
“Of the listed companies in the NSE 26 of them have women on the board with 43 of them in top management some as CEOs All of them by merit ” CEO PLC

“With 70 of GDP and 80 of employment coming from the Private Sector KENYA provided support in food donations cash restructures services sanitisation stations as well as PPE kits where needed ” CEO KENYA

Many SMEs mostly led by women struggled with their economic obligations Most reacted by reducing business and some were led to lay off staff However many adapted by sourcing elsewhere for material and aligning to the new normal’s economical needs
“@KEPSA KENYA is playing a leading role in advancing Gender Equality We have 9 men and 6 lady directors as well as 3 men and 6 ladies in Management ” CEO KENYA
“I’m really proud of the Milestones Kenya has made more so in the Corporate space with more women faces especially in the C Suite ” CEO KENYA
“It’s encouraging to join 90 other Stock Exchange’s around the world in advocating for global gender equality ” CEO KENYA
“49 of board seats at IFC World bank group are held by women a big move towards attaining Gender Equality ” Stephanie Von Friedeburg Senior VP Operations
Happy to all the women in the world

The derivative itself is merely a contract between two or more parties Investors buy or sell derivatives to manage the risk associated with the underlying security to protect against fluctuations in value or to profit from market movements
There are 4 types of derivate instruments futures forwards swaps amp options NSE specialises in Contracts

Derivatives are traded in two types of markets over the counter OTC amp on an exchange In an OTC parties trade directly with each other on their terms without going through an intermediary while on an exchange trading is standardised amp prices transparent
A derivative is a financial instrument whose characteristics and value depend on an underlying asset The asset can be an equity currency bond interest rate commodity or even the weather
